dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgHatch

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgObject
          dxf2svg.svg.SvgGraphicElement
              dxf2svg.svg.SvgHatch
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public final class SvgHatch
extends SvgGraphicElement

SvgHatch encapsulates the Dxf object, HATCH. A hatch is made up of a boundary path and a fill pattern. The boundary path is in turn, made up of one or more sub-objects namely polyline, line, circular arc, elliptical arc or spline in various combinations.

The hatch pattern fill is a collection of SvgHatchLine objects that describe a pattern much like the line type descriptions in TableLineType.

SvgHatch, upon initialization, enters a machine state and continues until state change cues are received while processing the dxf data. Each state changes the context of the data being collected and dictates the expected data type of the object currently being processed. This is done because a large number group codes are reused throughout a hatch's description.

There are three different types of objects that are required to define a hatch in AutoCAD:

  • SvgHatch: an SvgGraphicElement object, whose primary task is to describe the boundary of the hatch as a continuous path.
  • SvgHatchPattern: is an SvgCollection object, that holds all the SvgHatchLine elements that are used to create the hatch pattern. There is only one SvgHatchPattern for each hatch in a DXF, but the SvgHatchPattern object is passed back to the DxfConverter and kept for outputting in the Svg header. Other SvgHatch objects may re-use the SvgHatchPattern object and SvgHatchPattern objects can determine if they have already been defined.
  • SvgHatchLine: There may be zero or more of these objects depending on whether the hatch is a solid and, in-turn, the complexity of the pattern being described. A simple slanted line pattern is one line, but other patterns like 'echer' contain 20 or 30. This object is a decendant of SvgLine but unlike its parent object, it may contain dashed lines and angle describing data.

Version:
0.01 - November 28, 2002
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SvgHatch

Method Detail

setState

protected void setState(int state)
Sets the current operating state of this hatch object.

Throws:
UnknownHatchStateException - if an attempt to switch to an unknown state is made.

getState

protected int getState()
Returns the current machine state. The machine state for this object could be one of the following states: ELEVATION the initial state of the machine. Named after the first need to change states - the elevation group pair. The next state is the BOUNDARY state which is defined by one of the following sub-states: POLYLINE, LINE, CIRCULAR_ARC, ELLIPTICAL_ARC or SPLINE. The last state is the SEED state which denotes the collection of seed points for determining the internal points of a complex boundary.

setFill

public void setFill(java.lang.String fill)
This method overrides the SvgObject.setFill(java.lang.String) method so that repeated calling of this method will concatinate and accumulate values manditory fill values. Unlike other SvgObjects fill can be one value or none at all. With SvgHatch there is always 'no stroke' attribute, a url to a pattern fill or solid fill colour and a fill-rule.

Overrides:
setFill in class SvgObject
Parameters:
fill - String value of fill (a colour like blue or #0066ff).

resetFill

protected void resetFill()
Allows for the resetting of the fill attribute. This may become necessary because there is always a fill attribute for a hatch object and the fill attribute usually takes a URL to a hatch pattern. The exception to this case is if the fill is solid. Then the fill is just a solid with either the layer colour or a user defined colour. In that case the URL is superfluous and should be deleted and the attributes that discribe a solid should be instated.

getFill

protected java.lang.String getFill()
Returns the fill type as a String ready to be used as an attribute value if one is set returns null otherwise. Overrides SvgObject.getFill() to allow proper parsing of the manitory fill attirbutes.

Overrides:
getFill in class SvgGraphicElement
Returns:
String fill:#somenum;

Closes any open object and adds it to the boundary path vector.

setPatternName

public void setPatternName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the hatch pattern name which other SvgObjects refer to as a fill.

setSolidFill

public void setSolidFill(boolean isSolid)
Sets whether the hatch is a pattern fill or a solid fill. If the value is true then the hatch is filled with a solid, if it is false, the appropriate hatch pattern fill is used. This value is set by group code (70).

Sets group code 10 which, depending on the machine state, could be the x value of a point, the x value of a center point, the x value of a seed point or the x value of an elevation.

setNumberOfPaths

public void setNumberOfPaths(int num)
Sets the number of loops (boundary paths) in the pattern. Set by group code (91).

setGroupCode92

public void setGroupCode92(int val)
Sets group code 92 which, depending on the machine state, could mean the boundary path type flag, but it always signals the start of a new boundary path.

See Also:
setHatchStyle(int)

setEdgeType

public void setEdgeType(int edge)
Sets the type of edge about to be described. Edge types can be of the following values:
  1. = polyline
  2. = line
  3. = circular arc
  4. = elliptical arc
  5. = spline

Throws:
SvgHatch.UndefinedHatchEdgeException - if the edge value is invalid, unknown or undefined. This could occur with splines as the spline conversion algorithm is still not developed.

setHatchStyle

public void setHatchStyle(int style)
This value sets the hatch style or fill-rule controlled by group code (75). Valid values are:
  1. = Odd parity fill-rule:evenodd;
  2. = outermost area fill-rule:nonezero;
  3. = Ignore style, hatch all fill-rule:nonzero;

setGroupCode40

public void setGroupCode40(double val)
Sets group code 40 which, depending on the machine state, could be the length of the minor axis as a percentage or ratio of the major axis for an ellipse arc, radius of a circular arc or knot values for a spline.

setStartAngle

public void setStartAngle(double val)
Sets the start angle of, depending on the state, an elliptical or circular arc group code (50).

setEndAngle

public void setEndAngle(double val)
Sets the end angle of, depending on the state, an elliptical or circular arc group code (51).

setGroupCode73

public void setGroupCode73(int val)
Sets group code 73 which, depending on the machine state, could be the isClosedFlag if we are talking polylines, the counterClockWise flag of a circular or elliptical arc or a 'rational' value if we are talking splines.

setNumberOfSeedPoints

public void setNumberOfSeedPoints(int seeds)
Sets the number of seed points. This refers to the point(s) that lie inside the hatch that define the internal bounding edge of a hatch.

setPatternLineAngle

Sets the angle of the line pattern from group code (53).
